stem: The hospital discharge planner is meeting with four clients. Based on the documentation in the Discharge Coordination Log, match each client's clinical profile with the most appropriate interdisciplinary service.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
Patient A: 52y/o male with Stage IV lung cancer. States he wants to 'stop chemo' and spend his remaining time (estimated < 3 months) at home. 
Patient B: 68y/o female with severe CHF. She is frequently admitted for fluid overload. She wants to continue treatment but needs help managing her dyspnea and pain at home. 
Patient C: 45y/o female following a car accident with a severe spinal cord injury. She is uninsured and needs help finding a ramp for her home. 
Patient D: 75y/o male with Advanced Dementia. His family is overwhelmed and needs temporary help so they can sleep and attend to personal business.

tabs.title: Pain Assessment
tabs.content: Patient A: 8/10. Patient B: 4/10. Patient C: 2/10.

rows.text: Prognosis < 6 months, focusing on comfort without curative intent
Chronic illness support, focusing on symptom relief while continuing curative treatment
Resource identification for home modifications and financial aid
Short-term relief for primary caregivers (Respite care)

rationale.correct: Hospice (r1) is for patients with a prognosis of < 6 months who are no longer seeking curative treatment (c1). Palliative care (r2) is for any stage of serious illness and can occur alongside curative treatments (c2). Social Work (r3) identifies community resources like ramps and financial aid (c3). Respite care (r4) provides temporary relief to family caregivers (c4).
clinicalPearls: All Hospice is Palliative, but not all Palliative is Hospice.
Hospice requires two physicians to certify the < 6-month prognosis.
Palliative care focuses on QUALITY of life, regardless of how long that life is.

questionTrap.trap: Thinking Palliative care means the patient is dying tomorrow.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Remember that a patient with chronic COPD can be in Palliative care for years while still going to the doctor for treatment.

mnemonic.title: Hospice vs Palliative
mnemonic.expansion: Hospice = Home-stretch (Near end). Palliative = Pain/Pressure relief (Any stage).
